intro: Felicia schimperi, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers with a central dark center. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are usually gray-green in color. Felicia schimperi is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
